channel.title: What does this mean?
channel.description: Now I'm wondering what people mean when they say something like this when they are showing off their sever The title says its a 317 yet in the description about it, it says it has something like [color=orange]gfx 602 npc 402[/color] and crap like that and they have graphics and npc models that makes a 317 look worst? i really wonder what they mean by that and would like to to know how to do something like that.

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

When they say 317, it means that is the protocol revision it uses.

Most servers these days use the 317 protocol, but have the client load data from a higher revision. Still a 317 server, but higher data.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“gravenfire23, post:9, topic:466187”][quote author=I am beast link=topic=577740.msg4146156#msg4146156 date=1352214559]
If it says something like “[317] 602 models, 525 maps.” That means it’s loading the server with a 317 format, with models and maps that have been added to the specific revisions. 317’s are typically what you want to start coding with. Delta would be ideal to start with, but you can’t doo TOO much with it. Pi would be the next step, then you move to whatever revision you would like. You can start anywhere, this is just so you can get the feel for coding. Just remember that with each base change, there are different coding patterns and formats.
[/quote]If you want to actually learn to program dont even bother with delta or PI, use hyperion or something thats not a pile of shit.[/quote]I disagree. I started programming with C++ and shortly moved to using wL servers like CheezScape 80 shortly after. I recommend starting with wL servers because most of the code is there to actually do something obvious, vs having a lot of management and optimizations. It’s a better way to understand programming.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

enzo42:

It means the server is shit

This is another good way of putting it!

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

FroyoScape’s intro:

People seem to have lost the point in RSPS. Watch servers like Deathlypvpz, whose coders think they are the best.
Who seem to have lost the point in RSPS.
We all started from us trying to add new items, that was, in my opinion, the Old Stone Age, we just tried to add Dragon Claws, eventually we got it, bcp, we got it, but when it all happened, our trend looked upon older items again.
And this cycle will continue.
When we finally programmed all the new RS features (Hybrid PvP started this), it became the New Stone Age.
However, we started to look upon our old items, the good feeling of successfully programming simple things.
We thought to ourselves, “We made our RSPS just like RS! Now what? Uhh…”
You just cannot think of anything due to you just copying RS.
Same updates as RS.
For the servers that think that new things are awesome and program them, tell me this.
Why should we play your server whereas RS has the same features but with the full features.
We are fully benefiting from RS if we copy, whereas, we should use our own ideas.
Andrew Gower wasn’t born with these ideas, he made them up.
That’s how RS came to be.
That’s the RS we know now and use to love.
That’s the RS that got known world-wide and turned to a master piece by Jagex.
If they thought of there own ideas, we should.
We should make a new RS, a new RS with our own RSPS features.
We should make anything our mind gravitates towards.
We have the power in our brain’s creativity to make a world-wide known RSPS.
Just only if we try. Do you think us programmers were made just to copy? No, we were made to build upon and make a better game.

Why you shouldn’t put 602 junk.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

I am beast:

If it says something like “[317] 602 models, 525 maps.” That means it’s loading the server with a 317 format, with models and maps that have been added to the specific revisions. 317’s are typically what you want to start coding with. Delta would be ideal to start with, but you can’t doo TOO much with it. Pi would be the next step, then you move to whatever revision you would like. You can start anywhere, this is just so you can get the feel for coding. Just remember that with each base change, there are different coding patterns and formats.

Gasp! Did you just suggest PI?

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?

If it says something like “[317] 602 models, 525 maps.” That means it’s loading the server with a 317 format, with models and maps that have been added to the specific revisions. 317’s are typically what you want to start coding with. Delta would be ideal to start with, but you can’t doo TOO much with it. Pi would be the next step, then you move to whatever revision you would like. You can start anywhere, this is just so you can get the feel for coding. Just remember that with each base change, there are different coding patterns and formats.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Just google the tut

But just to let you know

It will make your server look really generic, it looks horrible with 317 maps, client in general, etc.
And overall it just looks ugly.

If you are going to put high revision stuff, I’d say just use a higher revision server.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:2, topic:466187”]What are you asking?

If you’re asking what those servers are, they’re servers loading higher content.

‘What does this mean’ is a little misleading as a title. A more suitable title would be ‘how can I load 602 content into a 317’ or something of that matter…
To do this, you need to pack the newer content into the old cache.[/quote]
oh sorry i wash just wondering how was this even possible, but if you could can you lead to a tut on how to do this? I sorta want to update my gfx and character models and exc…, but thanks for telling me what that ment.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

What are you asking?

If you’re asking what those servers are, they’re servers loading higher content.

‘What does this mean’ is a little misleading as a title. A more suitable title would be ‘how can I load 602 content into a 317’ or something of that matter…
To do this, you need to pack the newer content into the old cache.

Read full topic
